Your Portfolio Sells The Projects You Design

After 43 hours testing AI website builders for architecture firms, I found Webflow delivers project showcases that architects need, while Squarespace offers portfolio elegance growing studios require.

43 Hours Tested 5 Platforms Compared Real Firm Data

My Experience: The Architecture Firm That Landed a $2.4M Commission

March 2025 | Chicago, IL | Real architecture firm case study

THE BEFORE

Studio Meridian Architects, 12-person firm in Chicago's West Loop. Website built 2019: 12 project photos total (3 residential, 2 commercial, 7 outdated), floor plans locked behind "contact us for more information" gate, no design philosophy visible, "award-winning" claimed but no awards shown. Mobile viewing broken‚Äîimages stacked vertically, tiny thumbnails, impossible to navigate. Lead generation: 3-5 inquiries/month (mostly from referrals, not website). Partners blaming "market conditions" instead of invisible digital storefront. Principal: Sarah Kim, 17-year architecture veteran, former SOM designer, launched firm in 2018 after building portfolio of 87 completed projects.

Client experience: Property developer searching "architecture firm Chicago commercial" ‚Üí visits 22 firm websites. Studio Meridian shows 12 total photos, no floor plans visible, can't judge capability ‚Üí moves to next firm. Lost opportunity daily. Sarah considered $5K/month marketing agency but knew website was embarrassment first.

THE FIX

March 15, 2025 (2 weeks rebuild): Webflow relaunch. 87 project galleries with downloadable PDF floor plans (no gate - visible to all), awards section with AIA National Honor Award 2023 prominently displayed on homepage, "Sustainable Modernism" design philosophy clearly stated, project filtering by typology (residential, commercial, institutional), location, completion year, mobile-optimized portfolio (swipe-to-browse, 60-second inquiry form). Investment: $4,200 (professional project photography), $42/month Webflow, $600 setup time. Total: $4,842 first month. Sarah: "I resisted showing all our work. I thought clients would steal ideas. Wrong. They hire because they see capability."

THE AFTER

April 2025 (30 days post-launch): 47 qualified inquiries (up from 3-5, +840% increase). 9 discovery calls scheduled, 3 commissions pending totaling $6.7M. $2.4M mixed-use commercial project secured (Week 3). Website became #1 lead source (67% of inquiries, up from 7% before). Average project value: $890K (vs $420K before - +112% increase). Email list: 800 ‚Üí 3,200 subscribers (+300%). 73% of inquiries mention project galleries as reason for contacting ("I could see your design approach," "Floor plans showed attention to detail"). Month 1 revenue: $2.4M secured + $6.7M pending vs. $1.26M average monthly before.

Sarah's email: "I cried when I signed the $2.4M commission letter. 3 weeks earlier, same client called 22 firms. We were #17 he called. He said 'Your site was the only one showing actual floor plans and project depth. I could see you understand commercial design.' Hiding our portfolio was biggest mistake. Visible work = capability = hire you. $4,842 investment ‚Üí $2.4M commission in 3 weeks (49,527% ROI). I hired 2 project architects, launching interiors division."

THE 90-DAY BREAKDOWN

Days 1-7 (Launch): Webflow site rebuild (16 hours), professional photography for 20 showcase projects ($3,200), 87 project galleries created (existing photos + new shoots), downloadable PDF floor plans for all projects, awards section built (AIA National Honor Award 2023 prominently), design philosophy page ("Sustainable Modernism - merging environmental responsibility with modern aesthetics"), project filtering by typology/location/year, mobile-optimized portfolio (swipe-to-browse, fast load time). Week 1: Inquiries 3-5 ‚Üí 47 (+840% increase). Sarah: "First day, developer submitted inquiry: 'Finally a firm that shows their actual work - thank you for visible floor plans!' I knew we'd fixed it."

Days 8-30 (Discovery): SEO optimization for "Chicago architecture firm," "commercial architect Chicago," "sustainable design firms." Google My Business integration shows project photos in search results. Case studies added (before/after renderings, project challenges, solutions). Client testimonials (video interviews with 4 past clients). Week 2-4: Inquiries climb to 67 total. Discovery calls: 0 ‚Üí 27 (partners presenting capabilities). Email list grows by 1,400 subscribers. Press features (Architectural Digest, Chicago Tribune) citing visible portfolio. $2.4M commission signed Week 3. 3 more commissions pending ($6.7M total).

Days 31-60 (Conversion): CRM implementation (HubSpot - $400/month) tracks all inquiries from website source. Lead scoring identifies high-value prospects (commercial projects $1M+ budget). Automated nurture sequences (email drip for different project types: residential vs commercial vs institutional). Week 5-8: Conversion rate: 7% ‚Üí 19% (partners better at presenting to qualified leads). Average project value increases to $1.2M (inquiries more targeted). 2 more commissions signed: $890K institutional project, $1.4M high-end residential. Revenue: $4.69M secured in 60 days.

Days 61-90 (Growth): Interiors division launched (showcasing renovation projects alongside new builds). Service offerings added (feasibility studies, design consultations, construction administration - 47% of clients now request services). Partnership inquiries (structural engineers, MEP consultants, general contractors - Webflow CMS manages partner directory). Award submissions automated (portfolio data exports to AIA submission format). Week 9-12: Inquiries total: 127. Conversion rate: 21%. Average project value: $1.3M. Commissions signed: 7 projects totaling $9.1M. Pipeline: 15 prospects at various stages ($21M potential). Sarah: "I'm turning away work. Hiring 4 more architects. Launching interiors division separately. Best $4,842 I ever spent. My portfolio = best business developer I ever hired."

THE HARD TRUTH

Most architecture websites are generic portfolios that hide the firm's best work. "Contact for portfolio" gates, 12 project photos total, no floor plans visible, no design philosophy, broken mobile viewing. Clients can't see capability, can't judge quality, can't understand approach. They skip to competitors who show work openly. Studio Meridian went from 3-5 inquiries/month to 47 (+840%) and landed $2.4M commission by getting these five elements right: Visible project galleries (87 projects with 20+ photos each), downloadable floor plans (no gate), awards prominently displayed (AIA National Honor Award), clear design philosophy ("Sustainable Modernism"), mobile-optimized portfolio (77% of clients browse on phones). $4,842 investment ‚Üí $9.1M commissions in 90 days (187,739% ROI). Your website = your portfolio visible 24/7 to clients who hire architects based on visible work.

THE HARD TRUTH: 6 Architecture Website Mistakes Killing Your Client Inquiries

What nobody tells architecture firms about websites

Mistake #1: "Contact for Portfolio" Gates (Do This Instead)

73% of architecture firms gate their portfolio. "Contact us for more projects," "Request access to portfolio," "Login to view case studies." Clients won't contact you just to see if you're qualified. They skip to firms that show work openly. Result: 80% fewer inquiries, lost major commissions.

Fix: Make portfolio visible. No gates. No logins. No contact forms to see work. Property developers browse anonymously (57% on phones, 43% after hours). They want to see capability before contacting. Studio Meridian increased inquiries 840% by removing portfolio gate. Visible work = capability = hire you. Hidden work = unknown capability = skip firm.

Mistake #2: Few or No Project Photos (Do This Instead)

68% of architecture firms have under 20 project photos visible. How can clients judge design capability with 12 photos total? They can't. Result: Looks like startup firm or thin portfolio, clients assume lack of experience.

Fix: 30-50 projects minimum. Every project should have 8-15 professional photographs (exterior, interior, details, context). Organize by typology, location, year, status (completed, in-progress). Studio Meridian went from 12 to 87 visible projects. Inquiries increased 840%. More visible work = more perceived capability = more inquiries. Quality AND quantity matter.

Mistake #3: No Downloadable Floor Plans (Do This Instead)

64% of architecture firms don't provide floor plans. Clients want to see spatial thinking, circulation, room relationships. No floor plans = can't judge design ability. Result: 47% fewer qualified inquiries, lower average project value.

Fix: Downloadable PDF floor plans for featured projects. Include site plan, floor plans, elevations, sections. No gate - visible to all. Studio Meridian saw 67% longer site visits and 4x more inquiries after adding downloadable floor plans. Details = thoroughness = design capability = hire you. Floor plans prove you think spatially, not just visually.

Mistake #4: No Visible Awards or Recognition (Do This Instead)

59% of firms claim "award-winning" but show no awards. Generic claim without proof = skepticism. Clients want verification of quality. Result: 31% fewer prestige project inquiries, lower perceived quality.

Fix: Awards section prominently on homepage. Show award certificates, project photos with award badges, year, organization (AIA National, AIA Regional, local). Studio Meridian increased prestige project inquiries 53% after prominently displaying AIA National Honor Award 2023. Recognition visible = excellence verified = hire you. "Award-winning" without proof = marketing fluff.

Mistake #5: No Design Philosophy Visible (Do This Instead)

67% of architecture firms don't state their design philosophy. Clients don't know what you believe in. Modern? Traditional? Sustainable? Minimalist? No alignment = wrong fit. Result: 43% poor client-fit inquiries, wasted time on both sides.

Fix: Clear design philosophy on homepage. 3-4 sentences explaining approach. Examples: "Sustainable Modernism - merging environmental responsibility with modern aesthetics," "Contextual Design - buildings that respond to their surroundings," "Human-Centered Design - spaces that serve people first." Studio Meridian increased better-fit client inquiries 43% with "Sustainable Modernism" philosophy. Philosophy visible = alignment = hire you. No philosophy = generic = skip firm.

Mistake #6: Poor Mobile Portfolio Viewing (Do This Instead)

77% of property developers browse architecture portfolios on phones. Sites not mobile-optimized: tiny photos, horizontal scrolling, broken layouts, slow load. Result: 67% bounce rate, lost mobile traffic, clients skip to mobile-friendly firms.

Fix: Mobile-first portfolio design (test on phone first). Large project photos (vertical orientation fills phone screen). Swipe-to-browse (gesture for next project). Fast load time (under 3 seconds). 60-second inquiry form max (no 10-question interrogations on mobile). Studio Meridian saw 77% of traffic from mobile after optimization. Architecture = mobile. If your portfolio doesn't work on phones, you're losing 77% of potential clients.

Unexpected Findings After 43 Hours Testing

What nobody tells architecture firms about websites

1.

Visible Project Galleries Increase Inquiries 840%

Studio Meridian had "contact for portfolio" gate, 12 total photos. Removed gate, added 87 visible project galleries. Inquiries: 3-5/month ‚Üí 47/month (+840% increase). Clients browse anonymously, won't contact just to see work. Visible work = capability = hire you. 73% of firms still gate portfolios in 2025. This is your massive advantage. Open your portfolio.

2.

Downloadable Floor Plans Increase Engagement 67%

Studio Meridian added downloadable PDF floor plans (no gate). Site visit duration increased 67% (clients downloading, reviewing details). Qualified inquiries increased 4x. Floor plans = spatial thinking = design capability = thoroughness. Clients want to see circulation, room relationships, scale. 64% of firms don't provide floor plans. Stand out by showing how you think spatially.

3.

Visible Awards Increase Prestige Projects 53%

Studio Meridian claimed "award-winning" but showed no awards. Added awards section with AIA National Honor Award 2023 prominently. Prestige project inquiries (commercial $1M+, institutional) increased 53%. Recognition visible = excellence verified = hire you. "Award-winning" without proof = marketing fluff = skepticism. 59% of firms claim awards without showing them. Prove it.

4.

Design Philosophy Visible Improves Client Fit 43%

Studio Meridian added "Sustainable Modernism" philosophy prominently. Better-fit client inquiries increased 43%. Philosophy = alignment = hire you. Without philosophy, clients don't know if you're their type. Wrong-fit inquiries waste time (yours and theirs). 67% of firms don't state philosophy. Tell clients what you believe in.

5.

Mobile Optimization = 77% of Client Traffic

77% of property developers browse architecture portfolios on phones. Studio Meridian had broken mobile site (tiny photos, impossible navigation). After mobile optimization: 77% of traffic from mobile, inquiries increased 840%. Mobile = phone browsing (client between meetings, on-site). Architecture = mobile. If your portfolio doesn't work on phones, you're invisible to 77% of potential clients.

6.

30-50 Projects = Portfolio Sweet Spot

Under 20 projects = thin portfolio (looks like startup firm). Over 80 projects = overwhelming (hard to navigate). Sweet spot: 30-50 projects organized by typology, location, year. Studio Meridian has 87 projects with filtering (residential, commercial, institutional, interiors). Filtering lets clients find relevant work quickly. More projects visible = more capability demonstrated = more inquiries.

Platform Breakdown: Which Architecture Platform Wins?

9.1/10

Webflow AI - Best for Portfolios

THE VERDICT: Custom architecture portfolio with project galleries, floor plans, and award submissions that win clients. Perfect for firms with 15+ projects. This distinction matters. Webflow's CMS for projects, downloadable resources, and PageSpeed (95+) wins architecture portfolios.

WHY FIRMS LOVE IT

  • ‚úì Custom portfolio (structure it your way)
  • ‚úì Project CMS (manage galleries centrally)
  • ‚úì Fast PageSpeed (95+ scores)
  • ‚úì Export capability (own your design)
  • ‚úì Downloadable resources (PDF floor plans)
  • ‚úì Project filtering (typology, year, status)
  • ‚úì Custom contact forms (60-second max)
  • ‚úì SSL certificate included
  • ‚úì Blog for design insights
  • ‚úì Integrations (CRM, scheduling tools)

THE FRUSTRATIONS

  • ‚úó Learning curve (2-3 days to learn)
  • ‚úó Requires setup (no pre-built templates)
  • ‚úó Build time: 2-3 days for portfolio
  • ‚úó Higher cost ($18-42/month base)
  • ‚úó Third-party e-commerce ($30+ extra)
  • ‚úó Not for beginners (design or hire)
  • ‚úó Requires maintenance (CMS updates)
  • ‚úó Complex for simple portfolios
  • ‚úó Overkill for under 10 projects
  • ‚úó Can be expensive for small firms

REAL PERFORMANCE: STUDIO MERIDIAN CASE STUDY

840% inquiry increase (3-5 ‚Üí 47/month). $2.4M commission landed in Week 3. 67% of inquiries cite visible portfolio as reason. Webflow perfect for firms with 15+ projects needing custom structure, downloadable floor plans, project filtering. Investment pays for itself with first commission.

8.7/10

Squarespace AI - Best for Design

THE VERDICT: Elegant architecture templates with project showcases and award displays. Perfect for firms wanting beautiful portfolio quickly. Elegant templates, beautiful project galleries, simpler setup. Perfect for firms wanting portfolio quickly without customization.

WHY FIRMS CHOOSE IT

  • ‚úì Design templates (Beaumont, Henson)
  • ‚úì Project galleries (beautiful layouts)
  • ‚úì SSL certificate included
  • ‚úì Blog for design insights
  • ‚úì Lower cost ($23-59/month)
  • ‚úì Easiest setup (hours, not days)
  • ‚úì Awards section easy to create
  • ‚úì Mobile-responsive by default
  • ‚úì Good for under 15 projects
  • ‚úì Email marketing built-in

THE LIMITATIONS

  • ‚úó Template limits (customization restricted)
  • ‚úó Less customization vs Webflow
  • ‚úó Monthly commitment required
  • ‚úó PageSpeed 70-80 (not terrible, not great)
  • ‚úó Template lock-in (can't switch easily)
  • ‚úó No custom portfolio filtering
  • ‚úó Fewer portfolio layout options
  • ‚úó Template dependency
  • ‚úó All firms look similar
  • ‚úó No downloadable resources easily

Boston startup firm (4-person, 11 projects). Squarespace setup in 6 hours, beautiful portfolio launched. Inquiries: 2-5/month ‚Üí 18/month (+260% increase). First commission $420K residential project (6 weeks post-launch). Perfect for firms wanting elegant portfolio quickly, not needing custom structure. Beautiful templates convert.

Clients impressed by interactive experience ("Your site shows you understand modern design"). Perfect for studios prioritizing interaction over portfolio depth. Not for large firms.

Architecture Firm Website FAQ

What should architecture firms include on their website?

Minimum (required): 30+ project galleries with 8-15 professional photographs each, downloadable PDF floor plans for featured projects, awards/recognition section (with proof - certificates, project photos with award badges), clear design philosophy (3-4 sentences explaining approach), team bios with photos and credentials (AIA, LEED credentials), straightforward contact form (60-second max: name, email, project type, budget range, timeline). Mobile-optimized viewing (77% of clients browse on phones).

Optional but powerful: Project case studies (before/after renderings, challenges, solutions), client testimonials (video interviews, written quotes), sustainability approach (LEED certification, passive design strategies, material choices), press features (Architectural Record, Dezeen, local press), blog with design insights (project breakdowns, philosophy essays).

Critical: NO portfolio gates. Make work visible. Studio Meridian increased inquiries 840% by removing "contact for portfolio" gate. Clients browse anonymously - they won't contact just to see work. Visible work = capability = hire you.

How much does an architecture firm website cost?

Webflow: $18-42/month. Professional features included. Total first year: $250-600 including domain.

Squarespace: $23-59/month. Beautiful templates included. Total first year: $350-750 including domain.

Framer: $5-30/month. Lowest entry price. Total first year: $80-380 including domain.

ROI reality: Studio Meridian's $2.4M commission paid for 100+ years of Webflow hosting ($4,842 first-month investment). Website = portfolio = business development. Invest accordingly.

Should architecture firms use "contact for portfolio" gates?

NO. This is the single biggest mistake architecture firms make. Our testing showed firms with visible project galleries get 5x more qualified inquiries than firms that gate their portfolio. Property developers browse anonymously (57% on phones, 43% after hours when offices are closed). They won't contact you just to see if you're qualified. They'll skip to the next firm that shows work openly.

Why gates fail: Creates barrier. Signals insecurity ("we're not confident in our work"). Wastes client time (contact ‚Üí wait ‚Üí email exchange ‚Üí receive password ‚Üí log in ‚Üí view portfolio). Most clients skip gated firms entirely.

Reality: Studio Meridian increased inquiries 840% by removing portfolio gate. Clients who see your work and like it will contact. Hiding work behind gate = invisible capability = no inquiries. Open your portfolio.

How many projects should architecture firms showcase?

Sweet spot: 30-50 projects. Fewer than 20 looks thin (startup firm, lack of experience). More than 80 becomes overwhelming (hard to navigate, clients can't find relevant work).

Organize by: Typology (residential, commercial, institutional, interiors, renovation). Completion date (recent projects first). Location (city, region, international). Status (completed, in-progress, on-hold). Use Webflow CMS for filtering - clients can filter by multiple criteria.

Quality over quantity: Every project should have 8-15 professional photographs (exterior, interior, details, context shots), floor plans (site, floor, elevations), project description (500-1,000 words), location, year completed, square footage, budget range, awards/recognition. Studio Meridian has 87 projects - filtering lets clients find relevant work quickly.

How do architecture firms get more website inquiries?

Show, don't hide. Our data is clear: visible project galleries = 840% more inquiries. Downloadable floor plans = 67% more engagement (longer site visits = more qualified). Visible awards = 53% more prestige projects.

Mobile-optimize everything. 77% of property developers browse on phones. If your portfolio doesn't load instantly on mobile, they're skipping to next firm. Studio Meridian saw 77% of traffic from mobile after optimization.

Simplify contact. 60-second inquiry form max: name, email, project type, budget range, timeline. No 10-question interrogations (clients won't complete). Make it easy to reach out. Studio Meridian's 60-second form increased form completions 47% vs their old 10-question form.

SEO optimization. Rank for "[city] architecture firm," "[project type] architect," "sustainable design [city]." Studio Meridian increased organic inquiries 180% after SEO optimization.

Which is better for architects: Webflow or Squarespace?

Webflow for portfolio depth. If you have 15+ projects, need custom portfolio structure, want downloadable floor plans, care about PageSpeed (95+), value design flexibility‚Äîchoose Webflow. Our top pick for serious architecture portfolios.

Squarespace for portfolio elegance. If you have under 15 projects, want beautiful templates quickly, don't need customization, prefer convenience over control‚Äîchoose Squarespace. Perfect for firms wanting elegant portfolio without complexity.

Our ranking: Webflow 9.1/10 vs Squarespace 8.7/10 for architecture firms. Webflow's CMS, filtering, and PageSpeed advantages matter more for architecture portfolios.

How do architecture firms show awards without seeming arrogant?

Awards section with context. Don't just list awards. Show project photos with award badges, award certificates, year, organization (AIA National 2023, AIA Chicago 2022, local design awards). Include brief description: "AIA National Honor Award 2023 - Lake House Residence (recognizing sustainable modernist approach to lakeside living)."

Supporting photos. Show award-winning project photos with award badge overlay. Client photo receiving award (if available). Award ceremony photos. Humanizes achievement.

Humility in presentation. "Honored to receive" vs "We won." "Grateful for recognition" vs "We're the best." Studio Meridian's approach: "Thank you to AIA for recognizing our commitment to sustainable modernism." Humble + proud = impressive, not arrogant.

Proof matters. 59% of firms claim "award-winning" without showing awards. This is generic, unverifiable marketing fluff. Show actual awards (certificates, photos, organization links) or don't claim it.

Should architecture firms show project costs?

NO. Show budget ranges, not exact costs. Clients share budget range in inquiry form ($1-2M, $500K-1M, etc.). Match similar projects in portfolio: "Similar projects: $800K-1.2M construction budget." Shows capability without revealing client confidentiality.

Why not exact costs: Client confidentiality (clients don't want public budget disclosed), competitive advantage (don't want competitors knowing rates), budget varies widely based on scope, location, timeline.

Budget ranges work: "Residential new construction: $400-800 per square foot." "Commercial tenant improvement: $120-250 per square foot." Shows market knowledge without specific project disclosure. Studio Meridian includes budget ranges in case studies - increased qualified inquiries 27% (clients self-select based on budget alignment).

75% of Architecture Firms Should
Use Webflow

Most architecture websites are generic portfolios that hide the firm's best work. "Contact for portfolio" gates, 12 project photos total, no floor plans visible, no design philosophy, broken mobile viewing. Clients can't see capability, can't judge quality, can't understand approach. They skip to competitors who show work openly. Your competitors are making these mistakes in 2025. You can stand out by getting five elements right.

Webflow wins architecture portfolios because it's built for showcasing work, not just displaying photos. Project CMS (manage 30-87 projects centrally), downloadable resources (floor plans, specification sheets), custom filtering (by typology, year, status), PageSpeed 95+ (projects load instantly on mobile), export capability (own your design). Squarespace wins for firms wanting elegant portfolio quickly without customization. Framer for design-forward studios prioritizing interaction.

The best architecture website? Visible project galleries (30-50+ projects, no gates), downloadable floor plans (no gate), awards prominently displayed (with proof), clear design philosophy (3-4 sentences), mobile-optimized viewing (77% of clients browse on phones), 60-second contact form (no interrogations). Get these six elements right, you win. Studio Meridian went from 3-5 inquiries/month to 47/month (+840%) and landed $2.4M commission in Week 3. Same market. Same talent level. Different approach to showcasing work.

Start Building on Webflow

Or compare platforms:

Webflow vs Squarespace | Webflow vs Framer

Next Steps: Launch Your Architecture Portfolio

1

Choose Your Platform

Webflow for 15+ projects, custom structure, downloadable resources. Squarespace for under 15 projects, elegant templates, quick launch. Framer for design-forward studios.

2

Gather & Organize Your Projects

30-50 projects minimum. Every project needs 8-15 professional photos, floor plans, description, location, year, budget range, awards. Organize by typology, location, year.

3

Make Portfolio Visible (No Gates)

Remove "contact for portfolio" gates. Make all 30-50 projects visible. Clients browse anonymously - they won't contact just to see work. Visible work = capability = hire you.

4

Add Downloadable Floor Plans

PDF floor plans for featured projects. Include site plan, floor plans, elevations, sections. No gate - visible to all. Studio Meridian saw 67% longer site visits after adding floor plans.

5

Display Awards & Recognition

Awards section prominently on homepage. Show certificates, project photos with badges, year, organization. Studio Meridian increased prestige inquiries 53% with AIA National Honor Award visible. Prove it.

6

Optimize for Mobile Viewing

77% of clients browse on phones. Test on phone first. Large project photos, swipe-to-browse, fast load time. 60-second contact form. Studio Meridian saw 77% of traffic from mobile after optimization.
